t: Zion, the City of Our God
A Song. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah.
Great*pn is the Lord*s and greatly to be praised in*ld the city of our God! His*ln holy mountain,
beautiful in elevation, is*ld the joy of all the earth, Mount*ln Zion, in the far north, the*ld city of the great King.
Within*ln her citadels God has*ld made himself known as a fortress.
For*pn behold, the kings assembled; they*ld came on together.
As*ln soon as they saw it, they were astounded; they*ld were in panic; they took to flight.
Trembling*ln took hold of them there, anguish*ld as of a woman in labor.
By*ln the east wind you shattered the*ld ships of Tarshish.
As*ln we have heard, so have we seen in*ld the city of the Lord*s of hosts, in*ln the city of our God, which*ld God will establish forever. Selah*ig
We*pn have thought on your steadfast love, O God, in*ld the midst of your temple.
As*ln your name, O God, so*ld your praise reaches to the ends of the earth. Your*ln right hand is filled with righteousness.
Let*ld Mount Zion be glad! Let*ln the daughters of Judah rejoice because*ld of your judgments!
Walk*pn about Zion, go around her, number*ld her towers,
consider*ln well her ramparts, go*ld through her citadels, that*ln you may tell the next generation
that*ld this is God, our*ln God forever and ever. He*ld will guide us forever.
